qas.question: What was the largest number to use Underground shelters in September  27, 1940?
In 1940 what percentage used the Tube for a sleeping shelter?
What year did the government start giving out Morrison shelters?
Where could the Morrison shelters be used?

context: Communal shelters never housed more than one seventh of Greater London residents, however. Peak use of the Underground as shelter was <a0_0>177,000<a0_0/> on 27 September 1940, and a November 1940 census of London found that about <a1_0>4%<a1_0/> of residents used the Tube and other large shelters; 9% in public surface shelters; and 27% in private home shelters, implying that the remaining 60% of the city likely stayed <a2_0>at home<a2_0/>. The government distributed Anderson shelters until <a3_0>1941<a3_0/> and that year began distributing the Morrison shelter, which could be used <a4_0>inside homes<a4_0/>.:190
